image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'Putin can't divide, outlast or weaken us': White House at 75th Nato anniversary
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Melania Trump's rare appearance at Manhattan fundraiser in a $4,000 dress
item.description: ​Former first lady Melania Trump hosted a political fundraiser in New York Monday night, Daily Mail reported with details that the red Valentino dress that she wore cost $4,000. Melania hosted an intimate group at Trump Tower to raise money for the Log Cabin Republicans, the largest conservation LGBTQ+ organization.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'How the hell...': Pastor smacks wife on flight. This is the reason
item.description: A pastor smacked her wife on an Alaska Airlines flight flying from Seattle to Anchorage after she got upgraded to first class but he didn't. The incident took place on July 2 on flight 275 as passengers witnessed the horrific exchange between the couple. The Independent reported that a criminal complained was filed against the pastor.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why Nato summit is important for Joe Biden in presidential race
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Boeing horror: Mechanic sucked into engine in Iran's Chabahar
item.description: ​A mechanic was sucked into the engines of a Boeing plane at Iran's Chabahar Konarak airport in a horrific incident that took place earlier this month. According to reports, Abolfazl Amiri was dragged into the engine of the Varesh Airline's Boeing 737-500 when he went near the aircraft to get a tool. The engine was on for a test run.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'The Almighty calls for Biden: They want you gone, sir'
item.description: The Democratic-media establishment, often considered a powerful force in American politics, is urging President Joe Biden to withdraw from the presidential race, following his disappointing debate performance and subsequent media scrutiny, according to an editorial in the Wall Street Journal. The WSJ reports that the media, which had previously supported Biden, has turned against him, citing instances of cognitive decline.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why Nato is losing patience with Canada, Justin Trudeau
item.description: Canada has been avoiding its NATO defense spending commitments for over a decade, leading to growing frustration among allies. Despite being a strong partner in other areas, Ottawa has not met its domestic military spending goals or invested adequately in new equipment, making Canada an outlier within the alliance. According to a Politico report, a bipartisan group of 23 US senators expressed their disappointment in a letter to Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, urging Canada to fulfill its obligations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Biden skipped meeting with world leaders so he could go to bed'
item.description: President Joe Biden in June 2022 skipped a meeting with German officials just a few months after Russia invaded Ukraine so that he could go to bed early, the Wall Street Journal reported. The meeting was kept in the early evening but Biden took a rain check and the German officials were also aware of Biden's fatigue.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Collapsed in shower': This Australian family claims their fridge is making them sick
item.description: ​An Australian family has claimed their fridge is making them so sick that they have never experienced such symptoms in their life. According to an Australian news outlet 9news, Adele and Alex Rae -- the couple -- experienced irritation to the nose, eyes and throat because of a strange smell that they said was coming from their Samsung fridge on May 19.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'If I'm elected...': Donald Trump's massive 'will send them to jail' warning
item.description: ​​Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump said Wednesday if he is elected president, he will send all 'Election fraudsters' to jail for long period of time. "We already know who you are. DON'T DO IT! ZUCKERBUCKS, be careful!" Trump posted on Truth Social. Calling Joe Biden 'incapacitated moron', Trump said Republicans must pass the Save Act or go home.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Russia denies involvement in missile strikes at children's hospital in Kyiv
item.description: Russia has dismissed allegations of its involvement in the missile strikes that damaged a children's hospital in Kyiv on Monday, attributing the damage to Ukraine's anti-missile defense systems instead. Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov clarified Russia's position on Tuesday, stating that the destruction was due to Ukraine's defensive actions. "Russia's stance has never been to target civilian infrastructure in Ukraine," Peskov asserted, though he provided no evidence to support this claim. Peskov urged reporters to rely only on statements by official Russian authority.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif urges international community to recognise 'burden of Afghan refugees' in meeting with UNHCR chief
Flooding in northern Bangladesh displaces 40,000 people, shuts schools
item.description: Devastating floods in Bangladesh displace tens of thousands, with homes swept away and schools shut. More heavy rain expected to worsen the situation. Over 40,000 seek refuge in shelters as medical teams rush to treat flood victims. Villagers wade through knee-deep water, rescuing cattle and sheltering on makeshift rafts. Death toll rises in India with millions affected. Rare rhinoceros habitat inundated. Chaos in Delhi and Mumbai as heavy rains disrupt daily life.

item.title: Drug 100 times deadlier than heroin causes severe health risks in Australia
item.description: Harm Reduction Victoria has issued an urgent health alert after synthetic opioid proto-nitazene was found in cocaine, causing severe effects like loss of consciousness and respiratory depression. This follows a series of opioid overdoses in Australia, mirroring trends in North America. Authorities stress vigilance and the need for harm reduction services to prevent a potential crisis.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Do's and don'ts on Spain beach: Peeing on sand can land you in big trouble
item.description: The Marbella city council introduced measures in May aimed at improving beach quality, including fines of up to €750 for individuals caught relieving themselves on the beach, excluding the sea. Repeat offenders may face penalties of up to €1500 within a year. The regulations also target other disruptive behaviours like loud music and littering, aiming to maintain a pleasant environment across Marbella's 25 beaches amid peak tourist seasons.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Flight from hell': British Airways plane diverts after mid-flight lightning strike
item.description: A British Airways flight from Stuttgart to Heathrow was struck by lightning, forcing it to divert to Gatwick Airport. Despite the scare, passengers praised the crew for their handling of the situation. Another British Airways flight from Lisbon to London was also struck by lightning but landed safely. Both incidents were attributed to severe weather.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Satellite imagery shows Iran expanding its ballistic missile facilities
item.description: Recent satellite imagery confirms Iran's expansion of ballistic missile facilities near Tehran, aimed at increasing production. The move, supported by Iranian officials, includes supplying missiles to Russia for the Ukraine conflict. The US and Israel express concerns over the potential impact of increased drone and missile production.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Stunned' Prince Harry reacts to criticism over his nomination for ESPY's Pat Tillman Award
item.description: Prince Harry faced backlash upon being named the 2024 ESPY Pat Tillman Award for Service recipient, with critics, including Tillman's mother, questioning the choice. ESPN defended the decision citing Harry's Invictus Games contributions, yet a petition against it gathered 68,000 signatures. Critics argued others in the veteran community were more deserving, lacking Harry's privileges. Former NFL player Pat McAfee suggested a separate category for him, highlighting the controversy surrounding the announcement.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: United Airlines Boeing aircraft loses wheel after takeoff from Los Angeles
item.description: This marks the second instance in recent months where a United Airlines-operated Boeing aircraft lost a wheel following takeoff. In March, a Boeing 777 en route to Japan experienced a tire fall shortly after leaving San Francisco, necessitating an emergency landing.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Kash Patel? Security advisor of Donald Trump who may get position in FBI or CIA
item.description: Kash Patel, expected to be influential in a Trump second term, is tied to Trump Media (Truth Social) and paid advisory fees. He discussed media targeting with Steve Bannon, was considered for FBI/CIA roles, co-authored the Nunes Memo, held National Security Council positions, supported whistleblowers via his foundation, and launched Fight with Kash organization for educational initiatives.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
